intro: Hymenoxys floribunda, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features showy yellow-orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Hymenoxys floribunda typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
